concept.title: Look-forward and look-backward ranges
concept.shortdesc: If you define both a start and end point for a path, the path results include all interactions that occurred between the two touch points. However, if you define only a start point, you can specify how many days from the start point you want to look forward for interactions. If you define only an end point, you can specify how many days from the end point to look backward for interactions.

conbody.p: In the following example, an end touch point is defined as a Cart Purchase event that occurred from Feb. 1 to Feb. 14, with a look-back period of seven days. For each cart purchase within the event date range, the path includes interactions that occurred during the seven days before the purchase date. Look-back range from an end touch point
Notice that the seven-day look-back range for the February 3 purchase includes interactions that occurred before the start of the event date range.
The default look-back and look-forward range is 14 days.
